9DC5FAD8FFEF43A7B3BDF1D66685A7AD.description: Investigate methods to promote safety and infection control in the home care environment.

FDFBB393027A4031B31D603B35928495.description:
Apply concepts to make modifications or adaptations for procedures in a home-care
environment.

FF9A1D11A68D4040B048998B2D5F19B4.description: Differentiate the nursing assistant’s role in home care as compared to an acute and long-term care environment.

2F87F8E128424EEBB6D5ECC06C6A901D.description: Cite evidence of the proper role of the nursing assistant in a home health environment.

DD88C03F5EAD4647A6E9FCD8F9D033F6.description:
Examine and demonstrate the correct techniques to prevent pressure sores and
contractures.

9F0090F6F2B34A04BE7931906888E209.description:
Demonstrate correct bowel and bladder training and cite evidence concerning its
effectiveness.

F3F41662D3D445C4A105CFF7A0684564.description: Examine the resident/patient/client and performs range of motion exercises.

59154EA335B84E0093B65FD40ED0C13C.description:
Organize and demonstrate proper use of assistive devices and equipment when assisting a
resident/patient/client in transferring and ambulation skills, to include the correct use of a
gait/ambulate belt.

9D9176BF725D4C4EA185D0875A44C469.description: Assess and select methods to promote a resident’s/patient’s/client’s independence.

2D1A818771994B4C983140CBF31CEF0A.description: Differentiate the role of the nursing assistant for restorative care needs.

59E6088562994C2EB8C8BBE6FDF8A322.description:
Assess, demonstrate, and integrate principals of restorative care for the nursing assistant
to include maintaining a resident’s rights.

1CA4162DA8C84372B69FC19C8B3FE16D.description:
Investigate options to enhance pulmonary functions for resident’s/patient’s/client’s
receiving oxygen therapy

568AB3AB334F4D7AA4F87128676F11C3.description:
Simulate and then critique the required steps necessary to construct the care of the
resident/patient/client when death and/or post-mortem care is imminent.

9FB1CBF329254725BBC42311D51F850B.description:
Construct and implement facility guidelines which detail how to care for
residents/patients/clients with various drainage tubes.

D91C238BB08D405CB3E277948A239324.description: Utilizing standard precautions, submit specimens per facility policy and procedure.

B9526970E76A4756AD24A7A341C5B135.description:
Assess and revise as needed various types of urinary catheters while citing evidence of
effectiveness.

3187B8B22A1F4B68AB60A77BB772E128.description:
Formulate ways to implement and maintain fluid balance of residents/patients/clients, by
differentiating between dehydration and edema.

CA76664395504A508A1B7B15761096C9.description:
Cite evidence that differentiates abnormal changes in body function of all body systems
while keeping the supervisor apprised to the changes.

F4597323AF8443B58D815EF7199CC597.description: Model respect and management for residents’/patients’/clients’ environment.

6608C3A7680044BC88119F87A8993653.description:
Assess and document vital signs including blood pressure using manual and electronic
equipment.

1B00E61E16874EACAD917E25B7ACF272.description:
Perform basic patient care skills within the scope of practice for a nursing assistant while
maintaining resident/patient/client rights, including beginning and ending procedures
(i.e. washing hands, gathering equipment, identifying client, providing privacy, etc.).

5C4946D494AB4F27A4354E24DE8CC829.description:
Formulate a plan of care for the resident/patient/client evidenced by establishing a
routine elimination pattern.

98D5608FF23D475FBA7576EB18EC943B.description:
Investigate and compare the proper techniques used for feeding the
resident/patient/clients.

A2F91774CBEA43BBBC0FB6F60C2F433F.description:
Construct special diets and hydrations necessary to meet the nutritional needs of the
residents/patients, and the clients.

FD8DC0A6D494405DAF9B021E1399FEDB.description: Investigate and model the proper uses of adaptive devices for dressing and grooming.

6B4F3734B5CD427597C135BE26DE5655.description:
Compare and contrast shaving techniques between male and female residents and
patients; and investigate the safety hazards of an electric vs. a non-electric razor
contraindications of its use.

48F429EA74554388B9CC4546DB9011F1.description: Create a model that reveals how to perform a therapeutic backrub.

BF31C4D3CEA84D168EC8D499A1063355.description:
Assess the resident/patient/client by providing oral hygiene, denture care, and
eyeglasses care.

07524EFE4A28450C989A78EBE439FE99.description: Apply concepts of good skin care evidences by observation, reporting and recording.

32F0C8D35CE44E2A8658DF6E92C801FB.description:
Assess and assure the resident/patient/client of personal hygiene while providing
patient/client privacy.

51D899A989314D95A6720C86A7D40BA7.description:
Model the proper technique to administer a bed bath while citing evidence of
patient/client privacy and dignity.

06D1EE69435044D6A2835A2AC3EB938C.description:
Utilize information on the resident/patient/client care plan to assist with Activities of Daily
Living (ADL) skills while promoting the resident’s/patient’s/client’s independence. In
addition, beginning and ending procedures should be properly sequenced and
performed with all resident/patient/client care.

9AAC9F1174C643CBA5D237BA5C8C6940.description: Compare and contrast the roles of the other members of the patient care team.

F7460029869E4798AEF8AE78B1B3FA79.description:
Judge the effectiveness of one’s role as a team member in a patient care facility and
provide quality care.

275E43D6C2864EFFA00C2B5831809CFD.description:
Examine the role and responsibility of individual members of the healthcare team; and
interact effectively and sensitively with all team members in promoting the delivery and
quality of healthcare.

732B221F5E8E439A9389C152F8FF0127.description: Apprise and use Personal Protective Equipment PPE) correctly.

EFAC3D4E32EC4E03BA8027BFEB0B85D2.description: Apprise and use isolation precautions correctly when providing care.

45C7311F92D34C06BD4B78749A948889.description: Apprise and implement the use of standard precautions when providing care.

BF2AA3012124483594AA176683BE62A9.description: Cite evidence of medical aseptic hand washing techniques and demonstrate

986A776C23F9465583A6243327DBCB89.description: Describe and demonstrate infection control practices.

90B97335B0E740089E0CE254E7195A7E.description:
Successfully complete Basic Life Support CPR course by a recognized agency such as
American Heart Association or American Red Cross.

AF58BBE71A7845BFA54BDA7AEF83CC8D.description:
Select the correct restraints/safety devices according to facility standards and
demonstrate proper use.

1504BE5870E3438BB412D3267297DE48.description:
Discuss with the client the location and function of staff/emergency contact devices (call
light, restroom emergency button) and position within easy reach for the
resident/patient/client.

1C5047DE55AD49D7B7E18DBF4E131802.description:
Demonstrate procedures for positioning and transferring and turning residents/
patients/clients and assess proper technique.

813CF07041CC4B9EBED12D76B46DDA4C.description:
Demonstrate how to recognize and respond to medical emergencies including the
Heimlich maneuver for clearing foreign body airway obstructions for both conscious and
unconscious victims.

9E3385BE626B480792E6FFAADFF1E6D8.description: Formulate and follow emergency procedures for fire and other types of disasters.

3398CACED9C6433E9C963152B53795DA.description: Assess the use of correct body mechanics.

CD06B64F08BF4A69A7978401F5DA50B8.description:
Assess the safety of the resident/patient/client’s environment and cite evidence of safe
nursing assistant care.

EC1790796D90492A87A5BBABD8C5A58B.description:
Examine ways to promote safety and handle non-medical emergencies in the
healthcare setting.

9FABC2666E7E4093AEC5854220C96E7B.description:
Differentiate the nursing assistant’s role in various disaster situations in the healthcare
setting.

7ADC8B2690A6471882E834948E4E58D3.description:
Adhere to regulations and practice appropriate safety measures in providing
resident/patient/client care.

A10A3754B2424117ADD5093DCC2E1E9B.description: Examine the training requirements and scope of practice for the nursing assistant.

9D8ED739B82946EA8ED3682AD921F7C9.description: Formulate a plan of care for a dying resident/patients/client and family members.

0412E3A9B8BC4776BC2E2AD892F4CEE8.description:
Compare and contrast practices that would promote legal responsibility and the
consequences of failing to fulfill legal responsibilities.

0A2AD87479E04650AA7A1ADA24B13E03.description: Differentiate elder abuse, misappropriation of property, and resident/patient/client neglect.

F75A5EFF869841E19A0A25222AC8E688.description:
Practice confidentiality according to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
(HIPAA) and Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (OBRA) guidelines.

10E0E6FD7C74476C8B2CD95C0A2CB5D8.description: Assess the provision of resident/patient/client privacy as needed and provide accordingly.

EEF931D9527245358EC45A9AFD7B1E40.description:
Demonstrate responsible nursing assistant actions supporting resident/patient/client
rights.

DF55584554AB4564A914B8DA92719A10.description:
Adhere to the scope of practice for patient care assistant and demonstrate appropriate
actions while respecting a patient’s right to privacy and proper treatment.

23C65AFE6E154788A8C0DE203201ACB1.description: Adhere to approved institutional policies and procedures when providing care.

EADFD88937C94084A1B774A5B7D905F5.description:
Compare and contrast the relationship between various governmental and private
agencies that define the guidelines for resident/patient/client quality care.

69DC0E9C1DC447C0B8183AA80D16CEAA.description: Examine the administrative structure for healthcare agencies.

F54AB3EDD3F94A419A77D5DEA5E48AE2.description: Differentiate between long-term care and other healthcare agencies.

70939BFC26FD4439AB7E997BC383ECDA.description:
Analyze the organizational structure of the nursing facility and adhere to policies and
procedures.

B4734E109B024F14998E60E53025745E.description:
Assess the correct nursing assistant plan of action in providing care for
resident/patients/clients with cognitive impairments.

92AD7B60FE004CA5A5A60DF5E033D0A7.description:
Differentiate the signs and symptoms of various cognitive impairment including dementia,
Alzheimer’s Disease, delirium, and delusions that should be documented and reported.

9D1A95AD3D9C48A5B97B53CFE945BE0B.description:
Investigate the components of proper mental health and evaluate the inter-relatedness of
physical and mental health.

1A6D8C502D2B422FB6E71A135839243C.description:
Demonstrate appropriate behaviors meeting mental health and social service needs of
resident/patient/client.

6E09A1E35FB84DA6AEE7FE559D4A1EA7.description: Examine methods for communicating with residents with cognitive impairments.

67EF422F7808446EB92DE0331A62BAA1.description:
Formulate and show courteous and compassionate care for the resident/patient/client
and their family and friends.

6C8640D2CD3E4627A32CA201AE9EC544.description:
Select formal and informal, written, and oral, communication skills when planning and
providing care.

48E3156E59DF40DA826B6D433F7AD261.description:
Assess residents/patients/clients that have various sensory impairments to determine
effective methods of communication.

39776C8BB6AA46C3A5BEFDA39225F029.description:
Examine resident/patient/client procedures and conditions appropriately, using one’s
senses to make pertinent observations and record and report objectively.

E2059D25711540C79F3162C24F960031.description: Demonstrate correct use of appropriate communication devices.

80931AE6AB974594A2950A1F23A15234.description:
Utilize the correct medical terminology and acronyms according to regulating agencies
for effective communication in written documentation.

B69B184FF6884DAC83849061CCA0BE07.description:
Communicate effectively with residents/patients/clients’ healthcare team members and
resident/patient/client family or visitors using appropriate customer service skills.

ED5A4A50F37643DA8250BAFB67376508.description:
Investigate the need for restraints in accordance with current professional standards and
uncover alternative options.

A26677602D4F45D883D621A1CB40A6B8.description:
Examine care methods for freedom from abuse, mistreatment, and neglect and report
any instances of such treatment to appropriate staff/instructor.

57B0168C31AC45468B9F4E64F17C1B4B.description:
Adhere to facility policies and procedures regarding the security of personal possessions
of the residents/patients/clients.

48D43EC090BD437A9D3C6AC1179FCB0E.description:
Provide needed assistance getting to and participating in resident/patient/client and
family groups and activities.

747DCE946BE64C51A463FDE1250FEFC5.description:
Research the role of an Ombudsman to give assistance in resolving grievances and
disputes.

3A33DB29C768498F8319F100D4D48853.description: Apprise clients of their right to personal choices to accommodate their needs.

53CC2E7A2663460DBE9456680FB51779.description: Examine nurse aide practice in order to protect privacy and confidentiality.

5CFC004D36F94C249338152FECEBE024.description:
Maintain resident/patient’s rights and practice resident/patient/client’s privacy, according
to Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (OBRA) and Health Insurance Portability and
Accountability Act (HIPAA) guidelines.

CD2F3176E0194545839170FFDB05B299.description: Identify potential workplace stressors and formulate responses for management of stress.

BEE80602EEEF42F9AD067ED75C50D322.description:
Examine state requirements for licensure and discuss the purpose of continuing
education.

EF51FF82D85E4AAE98C6D33D7A6DA2CB.description:
Critique personal skills for seeking and securing employment and summarize strategies
for gaining employment opportunities.

51FDF1DC04C54FB28D4B40B8D552E60F.description:
Construct a personal career development plan, investigate how educational achievement
will affect one’s goals, and predict how choices affect family patterns and one’s lifestyle
show career progression (ex. CNA to LPN to RN).

3812E0DCB8D24C17A505C8B71AE7ADBA.description:
Construct the organizational structure for a healthcare business including the individual
roles and responsibilities of employees and their relationships to one another.

F48FBC683966474C8E742E261A48D82E.description:
Formulate an appropriate response to the needs of customers/clients and manage
conflict.

FF63D8EA0EBB4339B46129EC1D3DA28A.description:
Analyze an effective response to the needs of people of different ages, genders,
cultures, socioeconomic backgrounds, attitudes, and abilities and perform correctly.

E705C0443F43480C80DB3E558FF2F790.description:
Differentiate work ethic skills such as adaptability, dependability, and responsibility and
such social behaviors as tolerance, honesty, empathy, and courtesy and cite evidence of
them in the school and workplace.

700C2AFBA419448991805E0B50C643DB.description: Assess self accurately, set personal goals, monitor progress, and exhibit self-control.

4897D00E83414E93A7ECC4226BAD7E60.description: Apply the employability skills required for proficiency working in the Patient Care field.

1E19D8C6B6E14BFE98C16E545C2C1A16.description:
Uncover and examine the special needs of residents/patients/clients with disabilities,
including physical limitations, mental and emotional conditions, as well as dementias.

443ECD7F915540CB8C3168A32ED28C43.description: Respect and advocate for the resident/patient/client’s rights.

9D4474659777450D9A510A9FE3A346B2.description:
Examine the physical, social, and emotional changes that occur in the elderly and
chronically ill.

EAF86648407643989AC825E0DDAEE8D5.description:
Examine principals of human growth and development for the elderly and apply
knowledge.

832AEA9E80D54FABB579B63114302DAA.description: Discuss the philosophy of restorative care when meeting needs.

05B98D087BFC4FAB85EC3808FB6D1483.description: Examine the needs of the elderly and how those needs can impact their care and well-being.

92DBD24159EC4F1E8C5BB539E08B48EE.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

C12F3B9403B64D3C920DA76901FD6AE2.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace
to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

C896A9778EC7412DA7C52B8C74AE3731.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

C5B8F41B764E427EB556841AC980DF2E.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

DF954EE7B24445538CA143865151D8D3.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

55EE89FF185C4075948B7972C73D93D6.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

3C32819545CA4C449BE0546E2E9C001E.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
